items.title: She Smoked Weed, Legally, Then Gave Birth. New York Took Her Baby.
items.abstract: The city’s child welfare agency is not supposed to remove children solely because of a parent’s marijuana use. A mother says the agency did so anyway, and now she is suing.

items.title: Deadliest Russian Attack in Months on Ukraine’s Cities Kills at Least 25
items.abstract: The first widespread barrage on civilian targets in more than a month underscored the vital role of Ukrainian air defenses.
keywords: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity

items.title: Should New York City Have Free Buses?
items.abstract: Mayor Eric Adams has voiced support for the idea. But planning and funding such a venture will be difficult, some experts say.

items.title: 6 Cities on 5 Continents That Are Reimagining Urban Life
items.abstract: What we can learn from creative city initiatives, from Sydney to Paris.

items.title: ‘The Era of Urban Supremacy Is Over’
items.abstract: Many of the nation’s major cities face a daunting future.
